description: Specify a 1piboot.conf file to use instead of the one in /usr/local/sdm/1piboot/1piboot.conf.
errorMessage: A valid 1piboot.conf file is required.

description: Use APT caching. The argument is the IP address of the apt-cacher-ng server.
message: Enter the IP address of the apt-cacher-ng server.
errorMessage: A valid IP address is required.

description:
Some RasPiOS Bullseye images have a strange software configuration, which causes apt-get upgrade to fail. This switch forces sdm to use apt-get --dist-upgrade which updates correctly.
In the 2021-10-30 set of images, the 'with Desktop' versions have a set of problematic VLC modules installed.
Cause the user to autologin when the system (re)starts.
Call the function do_b0script in script when burning. script will be called after the output has been burned, and operates in effectively a Phase 0 environment.
errorMessage: A valid b0script file is required.

description: Like --b0script, but is called in an nspawn container.
errorMessage: A valid b1script file is required.

description: Do not provide an interactive command prompt inside the nspawn container.

Directs sdm-firstboot to run the boot scripts in /usr/local/sdm/1piboot/0*-*.sh. If --bootscripts is specified when creating the sdm-enhanced IMG, every SD Card burned will run the boot scripts on First Boot. If not specified on IMG creation, it can be also be specified when burning the SD Card to run the boot scripts on that SD Card.
message: Select a boot script directory.
errorMessage: A valid boot script directory is required.

description: Used only on --burn command. Item can be plugin: Check and update plugins
message: Select a plugin file, or leave empty for all plugins.
errorMessage: A valid plugin file is required, or leave blank for all.

description: By default sdm uses systemd-nspawn to enter the container in Phase 1/post-install phases. Some (likely older) host OSes may have issues with that. If systemd-nspawn fails with an execve error, retry the command and add --chroot.
Specifies the path to your Custom Phase Script, which will be run as described in the Custom Phase Script section below.
message: Select a Custom Phase Script file.
errorMessage: A valid Custom Phase Script file is required.

description: A source directory string that can be used in your Custom Phase Script. One use for this is to have a directory tree where all your customizations are kept, and pass in the directory tree to sdm with --csrc.
message: Select a Custom Phase Script directory.
errorMessage: A valid boot script directory is required.

description: Use the specified date format instead of the default "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S". See man date for format string details.
message: Enter a date format string.
errorMessage: A valid date format string is required.

description: Provide switches for the dd command used with --burn. The default is "bs=16M iflag=direct". If --ddsw is specified, it replaces the default value.
errorMessage: A valid dd switch is required.

description: Used with --burn. Expands the root partition on the SSD/SD Card after burning, and disables the default (quick) first boot that does this, since sdm has already expanded the partition.

Used in conjunction with the --xmb switch to extend an image. If used without --customize the IMG is extended but no other action is taken. If used with --customize the IMG is extended before the IMG is customized.
Specify the groups to be added to new users created with the user plugin. The default list is: dialout,cdrom,floppy,audio,video,plugdev,users,adm,sudo,users,input,netdev,spi,i2c,gpio.
message: Enter a list of user groups.
errorMessage: A valid list of user groups is required.

description: Specifies the name of the host to set onto the SD Card when burning it.
errorMessage: A valid hostname is required.

description: Starts a WiFi Captive Portal to obtain and test the WiFi Credentials during the First Boot. See Captive Portal for details. The flashled and internet options are not supported with --loadlocal wifi.
Set the maximum log line width before lines are split. Default is 96 characters.
message: Enter a width for the logfile.
errorMessage: A valid width for the log file is required.

description: Do not restart the system after the First Boot. This is useful if you set --restart when you build the image, but want to disable the automatic restart for a particular SD Card when you burn it.
Don't wait for the system time to sync in sdm FirstBoot.
Provide additional switches for the systemd-nspawn command. See man systemd-nspawn.
message: Enter one or more arguments for nspawn.
errorMessage: A valid argument for nspawn is required.
